characters.name: Dalmatian
characters.short_bio: Vice Admiral Dalmatian is one of the many Marine vice admirals to have participated in the Summit War of Marineford.

characters.name: Wanda
characters.short_bio: Wanda is a canine mink of the Inuarashi Musketeer Squad, previously also acting as a Kingsbird to both Inuarashi and Nekomamushi. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Zou and Wano Country Arcs.

characters.name: Judy
characters.short_bio: Judy is Marie's fiancé. He was shot by Charlos when he tried to rescue her.

characters.name: Koncelot
characters.short_bio: Concelot is a fox mink and one of the Three Inuarashi Musketeers leading the squad.

characters.name: Marie
characters.short_bio: Marie is the thirteenth wife of Saint Charlos. Before being enslaved by Charlos, she worked as a nurse in the Sabaody Archipelago, and was the fiancée of Judy.

characters.name: Camie
characters.short_bio: Camie is a kissing gourami mermaid that first appeared in Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll cover story. She first appeared in the main series after being spat out of a large sea boar that was saved by Hatchan, along with her starfish pet and master, Pappag. While dreaming of becoming a designer, she worked on Hatchan's Takoyaki 8 when she first met the Straw Hat Pirates. After the timeskip, she is a waitress at the Mermaid Cafe on Fish-Man Island. She is a central character during the Sabaody Archipelago Arc and also an ally of the Straw Hats in the Fish-Man Island Arc.

characters.name: Yamato
characters.short_bio: <!-- Yamato's pronouns are he/him as decided by the Wiki community, and listed as "Son of Kaidou" as written in the manga. Editing against this decision may result in a temporary ban. For more information, see the "Gender" section. To view the discussion or discuss when NEW material is released, use the Yamato Talk Page. --> Yamato is the son <!-- Yamato's pronouns are he/him as decided by the Wiki community, and listed as "Son of Kaidou" as written in the manga. Editing against this decision may result in a temporary ban. For more information, see the "Gender" section. To view the discussion or discuss when NEW material is released, use the Yamato Talk Page. --> of Kaidou. Born as Kaidou's daughter and groomed from a young age to be his heir, Yamato instead developed a profound admiration for the legendary samurai Kouzuki Oden. After Oden's death, Yamato decided to become like him, impersonating him and adopting his mannerisms. As a result of this desire to emulate Oden, Yamato decided to become a man and identify as Kaidou's son, with his father and the Beasts Pirates referring to him as such as well. This path has put Yamato at odds with Kaidou, with much of his life being spent imprisoned on Onigashima. Yamato befriended Portgas D. Ace during his visit to Wano Country, and after learning of Ace's death waited for the arrival of his sworn brother, Monkey D. Luffy. Yamato eventually met Luffy during the Raid on Onigashima, during which he took a rebellious stance against his father and fought as a valuable ally to the samurai against the Beasts Pirates. Initially desiring to join Luffy's crew, Yamato ultimately decided to remain behind in Wano to help protect it from outside forces, though he still intends to join them in the future. Yamato is a major ally of the Straw Hats during the Wano Country Arc. He also is the central character from the Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage Cover Page serial.

characters.name: Kashigami
characters.short_bio: Kashigami was a giant snake that lived on Jaya four centuries ago. It was worshiped by the Shandia as a god until it was slain by Mont Blanc Noland. It is the grandparent of Nola, who lives on the land in the present day.

characters.name: Fisher Tiger
characters.short_bio: Fisher Tiger, known as the Adventurer, was a sea bream fish-man and the founder and original captain of the Sun Pirates. A well-known explorer, Tiger became a slave for the World Nobles at some point in his adventures. After managing to escape his captors and return to Fish-Man Island, Tiger assaulted Mary Geoise in order to free his fellow slaves. This act granted Tiger infamy among humans and admiration from his fellow Fish-Men, particularly his long-time friends Jinbe and Arlong. Tiger died from blood loss after being ambushed and shot by a squad of Marines at Foolshout Island, following his delivery of a young former slave back to her home town. He is one of the two posthumous overarching protagonists of the Fish-Man Island Arc (alongside Otohime).
characters.japanese_name: フィッシャー・タイガー

characters.name: Ryuma
characters.short_bio: Shimotsuki Ryuma was a legendary, world-famous samurai hailing from the Shimotsuki Family of Wano Country, who lived during Wano's "Country of Gold" era centuries ago. He was revered for his mastery of swordsmanship that earned him the title Sword God, as well as his feat of slaying a dragon. He is the direct ancestor of Shimotsuki Ushimaru and Roronoa Zoro. 23 years before the current storyline, Ryuma's consecrated grave in Ringo was ransacked and both his corpse and sword, Shusui were stolen by Gecko Moria. Eventually, his corpse was reanimated by Brook's shadow and turned into a zombie to serve Moria on Thriller Bark, until it was destroyed by Zoro himself in a sword duel while his sword was eventually returned to his grave. He is the same Ryuma from Oda's one-shot Monsters and its anime adaptation, Monsters: 103 Mercies Dragon Damnation.

characters.name: Cocoa
characters.short_bio: Cocoa was a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew who impersonated Nico Robin.

characters.name: Holy
characters.short_bio: Holy is a dog raised and trained by Ohm. In addition to being Ohm's pet, he is a skilled martial artist in his own right.

characters.name: Karoo
characters.short_bio: Karoo is Nefertari Vivi's pet super spot-billed duck, a fleet riding bird (one of the fastest modes of transportation available in the Arabasta Kingdom). Alongside his owner Vivi, Karoo infiltrated the organization known as Baroque Works. With her, he ended up traveling with the Straw Hat Pirates for most of the Arabasta Saga after their cover was blown. He is the leader of the Super Spot-Billed Duck Troops in Arabasta.

characters.name: Shamba
characters.short_bio: Shanba is an inhabitant of Torino Kingdom. He was first seen at the time of Chopper's arrival.

characters.name: Albion
characters.short_bio: "Gashed" Albion is one of the rookie pirates who joined the Fake Straw Hat Crew. He has a bounty of 92,000,000.

characters.name: Benn Beckman
characters.short_bio: Benn Beckman is the first mate of the Red Hair Pirates.

characters.name: Yosaku
characters.short_bio: Yosaku along with Johnny are old friends and former bounty hunting partners of Roronoa Zoro. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Baratie Arc and the Arlong Park Arc.

characters.name: Jozu
characters.epithet: "Diamond" Jozu (ダイヤモンド・ジョズ, Daiyamondo Jozu?)
characters.short_bio: "Diamond" Jozu is the former 3rd division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates, serving as one of the crew's most prominent members.

characters.name: Roronoa Zoro
characters.epithet: "Pirate Hunter Zoro" (海賊狩りのゾロ, Kaizoku Gari no Zoro?)
characters.role: Master Swordsman; Pirate; Crew Combatant; Senior Officer; Rōnin (temporary); Bounty Hunter (former)
characters.short_bio: :The subject of this article is sometimes called Roronoa Zolo. Roronoa Zoro, also known as "Pirate Hunter" Zoro, is the Swordsman and [[combatant of the Straw Hat Pirates, one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet, and is publicly recognized as the right-hand man and number two of his crew's captain, Monkey D. Luffy. Formerly a bounty hunter, he is the second member of Luffy's crew and the first to join it, doing so in the Romance Dawn Arc. Born in the East Blue and raised in Shimotsuki Village, Zoro is a descendant of the Shimotsuki Family of Wano Country and the legendary samurai Ryuma; his grandmother Shimotsuki Furiko, the sister of former daimyo Ushimaru, emigrated from Wano to the East Blue. As a master of Three Sword Style, Zoro is one of the three most powerful combatants of the Straw Hats, alongside Luffy and Sanji, who are referred to as the "Monster Trio". His dream is to become the greatest swordsman in the world, to honor a promise he made to his deceased childhood friend and distant cousin, Kuina. In addition to his infamy as one of the Straw Hats and as a former bounty hunter, his sizeable bounty upon arriving at the Sabaody Archipelago caused Zoro, along with Luffy, to be included among the eleven "Super Rookies", pirates who simultaneously reached the Red Line with bounties of over 100,000,000 shortly before the Summit War. He, the other ten Super Rookies, and Marshall D. Teach would go on to be referred to as the "Worst Generation." Zoro gained his first bounty of 60,000,000 after the Arabasta Arc. It later increased to 120,000,000 after the Enies Lobby incident, then again to 320,000,000 after the Dressrosa Arc. Following the Raid on Onigashima, his bounty was augmented to 1,111,000,000.

characters.name: Soro
characters.short_bio: Soro was Helmeppo's pet wolf and the main reason that Roronoa Zoro was arrested by the Marines at Shells Town. He is classified as a Type C creature, "Big Savage".

characters.name: Zeo
characters.epithet: "Noble of the Fish-Man District" (魚人街の貴族, Gyojin-gai no Kizoku?)
characters.short_bio: Zeo is a Japanese wobbegong fish-man and the self-proclaimed "Noble of the Fish-Man District". He was an officer of the New Fish-Man Pirates before their downfall and disbandment. Due to his actions and role, he is considered to be a major antagonist in the Fish-Man Island Arc.

characters.name: Johnny
characters.short_bio: Johnny along with Yosaku are old friends and former bounty hunting partners of Roronoa Zoro. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Baratie Arc and the Arlong Park Arc.

characters.name: Kingdew
characters.short_bio: Kingdew is the former 11th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.

characters.name: Coffee Monkeys
characters.short_bio: The Coffee Monkeys are a kidnapping group based in the Sabaody Archipelago.

characters.name: Negikuma Maria
characters.short_bio: :For other characters with the same name, see Maria (Disambiguation) Negikuma Maria is a resident of Drum Island, and friend of Dalton.

characters.name: Raideen
characters.short_bio: Raideen is a former member of the Giant Warrior Pirates. Following the crew's disbandment, he returned to Elbaph where he was shown training Hajrudin 63 years ago.

characters.name: Ririka
characters.short_bio: Ririka is a bartender who runs a local bar in Shells Town. She is Rika's mother.

characters.name: Porche
characters.short_bio: Porche is a combatant of the Foxy Pirates. She is considered an idol by the crew and is loved by all of the men. Due to her actions, she is a major antagonist during the Long Ring Long Land Arc, and a supporting antagonist in the Foxy's Return and Spa Island filler Arcs.

characters.name: Charlotte Maple
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Maple is the 26th daughter and 57th child of the Charlotte Family, the youngest quadruplet sister of Mobile, Marble, and Myukuru, and a Longarm-human hybrid. She also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates. She was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Monkey D. Luffy on Cacao Island.

characters.name: Charlotte Marble
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Marble is the 24th daughter and 55th child of the Charlotte Family, the second quadruplet sister of Mobile, Myukuru, and Maple, and a Longarm-human hybrid. She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates. She was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Monkey D. Luffy on Cacao Island.

characters.name: Charlotte Mobile
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Mobile is the 31st son and 54th child of the Charlotte Family, the elder quadruplet brother of Marble, Myukuru, and Maple, and a Longarm-human hybrid. He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Tasting, governing over Futoru Island.

characters.name: Charlotte Myukuru
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Myukuru is the 25th daughter and 56th child of the Charlotte Family, the third quadruplet sister of Mobile, Marble, and Maple, and a longarm-human hybrid. She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.

characters.name: Moodie
characters.short_bio:
| colorscheme = BaratieColors | jname = ムーディ | rname = Mūdi | ename = Moody | first = Chapter 43; Episode 20 | origin = East Blue | birth = November 17th | jva = Hiromi Nishikawa;
Akiko Utsumi (Live-Action Series) | Funi eva = Colleen Clinkenbeard | liveaction = Amber Hossack Moodie is a woman who Fullbody took to the Baratie.

characters.name: Higuma
characters.short_bio: Higuma was a bandit and the leader of the Higuma Bandits, active in the mountains of Dawn Island. He was the first antagonist to be introduced in the series, and the first of three in the Romance Dawn Arc (third of three in the anime).

characters.name: Brontosaurus
characters.short_bio: Brontosaurus was a dinosaur who lived on Little Garden.

characters.name: Onimaru
characters.epithet: "Gyukimaru on Oihagi Bridge" (おいはぎ橋の牛鬼丸, Oihagi-bashi no Gyūkimaru?, Viz: "Gyukimaru on Bandit's Bridge")
characters.short_bio: Onimaru is a komagitsune who was once the companion of the late daimyo of Ringo, Shimotsuki Ushimaru. After the death of his master, he joined forces with Kawamatsu in collecting weapons for the final battle against Kaidou and protecting them from robbers. After Kawamatsu was captured, Onimaru posed as a human known as Gyukimaru on Oihagi Bridge, stealing weapons from people while continuing to guard the graves.

characters.name: Bepo
characters.short_bio: Bepo is a polar bear mink and the navigator of the Heart Pirates. He is the younger brother of the late Nox Pirate Zepo.

characters.name: Mr. 11
characters.short_bio: Mr. 11 was a Frontier Agent for Baroque Works and the partner of Miss Thursday.

characters.name: Mummy Mee
characters.short_bio: Mummy Mee is one of the houseparents, alongside Daddy Dee, of a World Government-affiliated orphanage situated on the Conomi Islands.

characters.name: Nekomamushi
characters.epithet: "Master Nekomamushi" (ネコマムシの旦那, Nekomamushi no Dan'na?, Viz: "Cat Viper" Funimation: "Master Cat Viper")"Ruler of Night" (夜の王, Yoru no Ō?, Simulcast subs: "King of Night")
characters.role: Yakuza Boss; Ruler of Mokomo Dukedom (former); Guardian of the Whale Forest (former); Retainer; Samurai; Pirate Apprentice (former)
characters.short_bio: Master Nekomamushi is a feline mink and the guardian of the Whale Forest on Zou. He was one of the two rulers of the Mokomo Dukedom, dubbed the "Ruler of Night", holding the position from 6:00 PM to 6:00 AM. He and Inuarashi serve as retainers for the Kouzuki Family of Wano Country, as members of the Nine Red Scabbards. Alongside Inuarashi he was once a member of the Whitebeard Pirates and Roger Pirates, serving under Kouzuki Oden. Pedro has claimed that he and Inuarashi must not be allowed to die because "the world is waiting for them". After Kaidou's fall from power, Nekomamushi became a yakuza boss in the Flower Capital. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Whole Cake Island and Wano Country Sagas.

characters.name: Chouchou
characters.short_bio: Chouchou is a dog from Orange Town, famed for his unceasing vigil over the pet-food shop founded by his deceased owner. He is classified as a Type B creature, "Small Friendly". He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Orange Town Arc.

characters.name: Ankoro
characters.short_bio: Ankoro is a gigantic anglerfish formerly under the command of captain Vander Decken IX, residing in the Underworld of the Sea, seven thousand meters underneath the ocean surface. Wadatsumi seems to regard Ankoro as a pet, as apparently Ankoro was told "not to eat ships" before.

characters.name: Kentauros
characters.short_bio: The Super Spot-Billed Duck Troops are a family of seven Super Spot-Billed Ducks (and later one camel) who serve the kingdom of Arabasta. They are led by their captain Karoo, and are reputed to be the fastest troop in the kingdom of Arabasta. All of the ducks have the strange theme of wearing different types of hats and various other jewelry and clothing. Also strange was that the last member to join the squad, Matsuge, is a camel who helped the Straw Hats confront Baroque Works.

characters.name: Kizaru
characters.short_bio: Borsalino, more commonly known by his alias Kizaru, is an Admiral in the Marines. After Kuzan resigned from the Marines and Sakazuki was promoted to Fleet Admiral, Kizaru is now the only remaining Admiral from the previous trio. He was first mentioned by Nico Robin during the Straw Hats' initial encounter with Aokiji. Due to his actions and role, Kizaru is the secondary antagonist of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc and Marineford Arc, and the tertiary antagonist of the Egghead Arc.

characters.name: Ran
characters.short_bio: Ran is a member of the Kuja Pirates.

characters.name: Charlotte Daifuku

devil_fruit.name: Hoya Hoya no Mi
devil_fruit.power: Allows him to summon a halberd-wielding genie from his body by rubbing his belly.

characters.short_bio: Charlotte Daifuku is the third son and fourth child of the Charlotte Family and the middle triplet brother of Katakuri and Oven. He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Beans, governing over Poripori Island. Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc.
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・ダイフク

characters.name: Charlotte Katakuri
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Katakuri is the second son and third child of the Charlotte Family and the elder triplet brother of Daifuku and Oven. He is also one of the Three Sweet Commanders of the Big Mom Pirates and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Flour, governing over Komugi Island. Due to his actions and role, Katakuri is the secondary antagonist in the second half of the Whole Cake Island Arc. He, alongside his younger siblings Charlotte Brûlée and Oven, become temporary and reluctant allies of the Red Hair Pirates and the Straw Hat Pirates during One Piece Film: Red.
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・カタクリ

characters.name: Charlotte Oven
characters.role: Pirate Officer; Minister of Browned Food
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Oven is the fourth son and fifth child of the Charlotte Family and the younger triplet brother of Katakuri and Daifuku. He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Browned Food, governing over Yakigashi Island. Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc. He, alongside his siblings Charlotte Brûlée and Charlotte Katakuri, become temporary and reluctant allies of the Red Hair Pirates and the Straw Hat Pirates during One Piece Film: Red.
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・オーブン

characters.name: Goro
characters.short_bio: Goro is Toto's younger brother and Koza's paternal uncle. He appeared in Gedatsu's cover story.

characters.name: Blue Gilly
characters.short_bio: Bluegilly (WT100) Blue Gilly is a martial artist from the Longleg Tribe. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi. He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc. After the battle with the Donquixote Pirates at Dressrosa, he became part of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet when he joined the XXX Gym Martial Arts Alliance, which later converted to a pirate crew called the Ideo Pirates.

characters.name: Tank Lepanto
characters.short_bio: Tank Lepanto is the commander of Dressrosa's Self-Defense Army. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.

characters.name: Agyo
characters.short_bio: Agyo is a Animal Species/Dressrosa Saga#Fighting Lion and a gladiator competing at the [[Corrida Colosseum for the Mera Mera no Mi.

characters.name: Bacura
characters.short_bio: Bacura is a black panther owned by the Kuja Pirates under Boa Hancock. She is said to be the executioner of the Kuja tribe, and has been serving the tribe for generations.

characters.name: Cerberus
characters.short_bio: Cerberus was a Wild Zombie who served under Gecko Moria.

characters.name: Vinsmoke Reiju
characters.epithet: "Poison Pink" (ポイズンピンク, Poizun Pinku?)
characters.short_bio: Vinsmoke Reiju, also known as "Poison Pink", is the eldest child and only daughter of the Vinsmoke Family. She is the princess of the Germa Kingdom and a commander in its military army, Germa 66. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates in the Whole Cake Island Arc and one of the central characters in Germa 66's Ahh... An Emotionless Excursion Cover Page Serial.
characters.japanese_name: ヴィンスモーク・レイジュ

characters.name: Shimotsuki Kouzaburou
characters.short_bio: Shimotsuki Kouzaburou was a member of the Shimotsuki Family and a swordsmith who crafted the Great Grade Blades, Wado Ichimonji and Enma. He was born in Wano Country, but illegally departed from there 55 years ago and eventually settled down in what became Shimotsuki Village in the East Blue. There, he fathered a son named Koushirou, making him the grandfather of Koushirou's daughter Kuina.

characters.name: Shimotsuki Ryuma
characters.short_bio: Shimotsuki Ryuma was a legendary, world-famous samurai hailing from the Shimotsuki Family of Wano Country, who lived during Wano's "Country of Gold" era centuries ago. He was revered for his mastery of swordsmanship that earned him the title Sword God, as well as his feat of slaying a dragon. He is the direct ancestor of Shimotsuki Ushimaru and Roronoa Zoro. 23 years before the current storyline, Ryuma's consecrated grave in Ringo was ransacked and both his corpse and sword, Shusui were stolen by Gecko Moria. Eventually, his corpse was reanimated by Brook's shadow and turned into a zombie to serve Moria on Thriller Bark, until it was destroyed by Zoro himself in a sword duel while his sword was eventually returned to his grave. He is the same Ryuma from Oda's one-shot Monsters and its anime adaptation, Monsters: 103 Mercies Dragon Damnation.

characters.name: Shimotsuki Ushimaru
characters.short_bio: Shimotsuki Ushimaru was a member of the Shimotsuki Family, and the last daimyo of Ringo in Wano Country before the takeover of Kurozumi Orochi as shogun 20 years ago. He was a direct descendant of the legendary samurai Shimotsuki Ryuma and the great-uncle of Roronoa Zoro through his older sister Furiko. After failing to depose Orochi, Ushimaru abandoned his name in shame and referred to himself as . Alongside fellow daimyo Fugetsu Omusubi and Uzuki Tempura, he helped inspire a young Yamato, the son of their nemesis Kaidou, to pursue his dream of becoming Kouzuki Oden.
